content: A strategic partnership is a business relationship between two companies that work together to achieve common goals. It is a mutually beneficial agreement where each company provides resources and expertise to support the other. The partnership may be formalized through a legal contract or simply through an informal understanding. The objective of a strategic partnership is to create long-term value for both companies, while also reducing risk and leveraging the strengths of each. Examples of strategic partnerships include joint ventures, licensing agreements, and marketing alliances.
